definitions.definition: convert (the words of a message) into a particular code in order to convey a secret meaning.
examples: only Mitch knew how to read the message—even the name was coded

definitions.definition: express the meaning of (a statement or communication) in an indirect or euphemistic way.
examples: a national campaign against “playing by ear,” a coded phrase that meant jazz

definitions.definition: assign a code to (something) for purposes of classification, analysis, or identification.
examples: she coded the samples and sent them down for dissection
most developers code C + + like C

definitions.definition: specify the genetic sequence for (an amino acid or protein).
examples: genes that code for human growth hormone

definitions.definition: be the genetic determiner of (a characteristic).
examples: one pair of homologous chromosomes that codes for eye color
